content.question: If <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x minus 9, and denominator the square root of x, end root, minus 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 9, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equivalent to which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, end root, minus 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, end root, plus 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator x squared, minus 81, and denominator x minus 9, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>81</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, x minus 9, close parenthesis, and denominator the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, end root, minus 3, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 9, of, open parenthesis, the square root of x, end root, plus 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
